latestVersion.versionNote: Added note in description of the Qualtrics survey pdf that the data from one question were discarded because the question was included incorrectly in the survey. See the descriiption and the paper for more explanation.

fields.value: Survey and Response Data for "Digital Rights and Freedoms" Project

dsDescriptionValue.value: These are the survey and response data for a study of MTurk users' ratings of the importance of principles and concepts associated with digital rights and freedoms. See the reporting publication for description and analysis.

publicationCitation.value: Todd Davies, "Digital Rights and Freedoms: A Framework for Surveying Users and Analyzing Policies", in Luca Maria Aiello and Daniel McFarland (eds.), Proceedings of the 6th International Conference on Social Informatics, (SocInfo 2014), Springer LNCS, November 2014

files.description: Amazon Mechanical Turk setup data for participants in the survey
files.label: Digital_Rights_and_Freedoms-MTurk-Recruitment-August-2014

dataFile.description: Amazon Mechanical Turk setup data for participants in the survey

files.description: Qualtrics survey in one pdf document. Survey takers were randomly assigned to rate one block of digital rights and freedom principles and concepts, and the order of the questions within each of those blocks was randomized also. Participants did not see the headers to each block (e.g. "Privacy Control". (Note that the fourth statement under "User Self-Governance" is a repeat (with elaboration) of the fourth statement (a description of the user modifiable platform concept) under "Software Freedom". The version of the statement that appears under "User Self-Governance" is a mistake. The description of participatory adjudication should have appeared there instead. For this reason, responses to the fourth statement under "User Self-Governance" are not meaningful. As noted in footnote to Table 1 in the paper,the data were discarded in the analysis for that question.)
files.label: Digital_Rights_and_Freedoms-Qualtrics-Survey-August-2014

dataFile.description: Qualtrics survey in one pdf document. Survey takers were randomly assigned to rate one block of digital rights and freedom principles and concepts, and the order of the questions within each of those blocks was randomized also. Participants did not see the headers to each block (e.g. "Privacy Control". (Note that the fourth statement under "User Self-Governance" is a repeat (with elaboration) of the fourth statement (a description of the user modifiable platform concept) under "Software Freedom". The version of the statement that appears under "User Self-Governance" is a mistake. The description of participatory adjudication should have appeared there instead. For this reason, responses to the fourth statement under "User Self-Governance" are not meaningful. As noted in footnote to Table 1 in the paper,the data were discarded in the analysis for that question.)
